titles.title: A bill to direct the Secretary of the department in which the United States Coast Guard is operating to cause the vessel M/V Polar Ice to be documented as a vessel of the United States so as to be entitled to engage in the coastwise trade.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

calendar.text: Committee on Commerce. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Commerce. Reported to Senate by Senator Hollings without amendment. With written report No. 100-419.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 791.

action.text: Indefinitely postponed by Senate by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: 6/24/1987--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the department in which the Coast Guard is operating to cause a named vessel to be documented as a vessel of the United States entitled to engage in the coastwise trade.
